Class Team

  • java.lang.Object
    • Team

  • public class Team
extends java.lang.Object
    Instances of Team represent teams of heroes in the game. Every Team object has a number of associated Hero objects. Every Team object is associated with exactly one Game object. A Game is considered lost when the corresponding Team object loses all of its Hero objects.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      An integer representing the amount of money the team currently has.

      All heroes currently on the team.

      The minimum length of a valid team name.

      A String representing the name of the team.

      An integer representing the number of maps the team owns.
      private java.util.ArrayList<PowerUp> powerUpsOwned
      An ArrayList of power-ups currently owned and not applied, initialised to empty.
      private int STARTING_MONEY
      The amount of money a team starts with.
      private int startNumHeroes
      The number of heroes to be added to the team initially.

      • MIN_TEAM_NAME_LENGTH

        private static final int MIN_TEAM_NAME_LENGTH
        The minimum length of a valid team name.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MAX_TEAM_NAME_LENGTH

        private static final int MAX_TEAM_NAME_LENGTH
        The maximum length of a valid team name.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • STARTING_MONEY

        private final int STARTING_MONEY
        The amount of money a team starts with.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • powerUpsOwned

        private java.util.ArrayList<PowerUp> powerUpsOwned
        An ArrayList of power-ups currently owned and not applied, initialised to empty.

      • healingItemsOwned

        private java.util.ArrayList<HealingItem> healingItemsOwned
        An ArrayList of healing items currently owned and not applied.

      • heroes

        private java.util.ArrayList<Hero> heroes
        All heroes currently on the team. This ArrayList is populated when a Team is created and depopulated as heroes die. The game is lost when this ArrayList becomes empty.

      • startNumHeroes

        private int startNumHeroes
        The number of heroes to be added to the team initially.

      • name

        private java.lang.String name
        A String representing the name of the team.

      • numMaps

        private int numMaps
        An integer representing the number of maps the team owns. Can be any non-negative integer. Having an Explorer on the team does not affect this value.

      • currentMoney

        private int currentMoney
        An integer representing the amount of money the team currently has. Could be any non-negative integer.

      • Team

        public Team(java.lang.String name,
            int startNumHeroes)
        A constructor for team, which sets the starting number of heroes which need to be added to the team.
        Parameters:
        name - The team's name.
        startNumHeroes - The starting number of heroes of the team.

    • Method Detail

      • isValidTeamName

        public static boolean isValidTeamName(java.lang.String name)
        Checks whether the given team name has a valid length.
        Parameters:
        name - The team name to check.
        Returns:
        true if the name is valid, false otherwise.

      • addHero

        public void addHero(java.lang.String heroName,
                    java.lang.String type)
        Creates a new hero with the given name of the given type, and adds it to the team's list of heroes.
        Parameters:
        heroName - The name of the new hero.
        type - The type of the new hero.

      • isValidHeroName

        public boolean isValidHeroName(java.lang.String heroName)
        Checks whether the given heroName is valid. A name is valid if it has not already been assigned to another hero on the team.
        Parameters:
        heroName - The name to be checked
        Returns:
        true if the name is valid, false otherwise.

      • takeDamage

        public void takeDamage(Hero hero,
                       int amount)
        Reduces a given hero's current health by a given amount. If health falls below 0, remove the hero from the team.
        Parameters:
        hero - The hero to take damage.
        amount - The amount of damage to be taken.

      • buyPowerUp

        public void buyPowerUp(PowerUp powerUp)
        Takes a new powerUp object and buys it if the team has enough money. If the team has enough money, the power up is added to the team's list of owned power ups, and the team's current money is decreased by the appropriate amount. If the team doesn't have enough money, an NotEnoughMoneyException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        powerUp - The new PowerUp instance to be bought.

      • buyHealingItem

        public void buyHealingItem(HealingItem healingItem)
        Takes a new healingItem object and buys it if the team has enough money. If the team has enough money, the healing item is added to the team's list of owned healing item, and the team's current money is decreased by the appropriate amount. If the team doesn't have enough money, an NotEnoughMoneyException is thrown.
        Parameters:
        healingItem - The new HealingItem instance to be bought.

      • buyMap

        public void buyMap()
        If the team has enough money to buy a map, increments the number of maps owned, and decreases the team's current money by the appropriate amount. If the team doesn't have enough money, a NotEnoughMoneyException is thrown.

      • popPowerUpFromList

        public PowerUp popPowerUpFromList(PowerUpType powerUpType)
        Takes a PowerUpType, and returns a PowerUp object of that type from the team's list of owned powerUps, removing it from the list. If the team doesn't own any power ups of that type, throws a RuntimeException.
        Parameters:
        powerUpType - The type of the power up to be removed from the list.
        Returns:
        A PowerUp object of the given type.

      • healingItemOfGivenType

        public HealingItem healingItemOfGivenType(java.lang.String name)
        Takes the name of a healing item, and returns a healing item of that type from the team's list of owned healing items. If the team doesn't own any healing items of that type, raises a NoneOwnedException.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the healing item to be found
        Returns:
        A HealingItem object with the given name from the teams list of owned healing items.

      • numPowerUpsOwned

        public int numPowerUpsOwned(PowerUpType powerUpType)
        Counts how many power-ups of the given type the team currently owns.
        Parameters:
        powerUpType - The PowerUpType of interest.
        Returns:
        The number of power-ups of the given type owned by the team.

      • numHealingItemsOwned

        public int numHealingItemsOwned(java.lang.String name)
        Counts how many healing items with the given name the team currently owns.
        Parameters:
        name - The name of the healing item of interest.
        Returns:
        The number of healing items with the given name owned by the team.
